versionHistory.changes: Pilot version
Set normal of planeprofile to sheeting side
Correct openings
Add warning for indexes >= 10. Set default indexes to 1
Set defaults overshoot
Deshrink individual sheets before joining
Set props readonly
Change defaults
Translate t9o ducth
Correct point filter on polyline
Assign to zone and draw visualisation on info layer
Add zone 1 as possible zone to process.
Allow multiple instances per element if zone index is different
Add to localizer
Correct insert name
Add option to saw if possible
Set the zone thickness if its not available on the zone.
Add allowed move directions
Add option to mill opening with a single operation.
Add option to overwrite overshoot
Add option to process only openings
Add filter options
Try to make the lines as continuous as possible. TODO: Find the best starting point.
Ignore openings with more than 8 vertices.
Ignore internal corner when its the first linesegment.
Filter is now case-insensitve.
Set ucs of plane profile before joining profiles.
Add tolerance for merging of sheets
Allow saw lines for internal corners too.
Add 'To' position if it is the before-last segment and it is swicthing from internal to extrenal corner.
Start milling at an external corner.
Only start at an external corner if it is NOT an opening (FogBugzId 3332) :-|
Add option to add the thickness of a specific zone as extra depth.
Update description.

usageEnvironment.detectionEvidence: The script uses `PrEntity` to select `Element` objects and adds tooling (`el.addTool(elSaw)`, `el.addTool(elMill)`) directly to those elements, which are database operations in Model Space. There are no references to shop drawing prefixes (sd_*), viewports, or drawing layout logic.

prerequisites.requiredSpace: Model Space with an Element containing zones/sheets.

data.raw_content:
```json
{
  "scriptPurpose": {
    "summary": "Automates the generation of CNC saw and milling toolpaths for sheeting zones (flooring, roofing, or cladding) on timber elements, optimizing cuts based on geometry and machine capabilities.",
    "category": "Machining / CAM",
    "typicalUseCase": "Used in the preparation of production data for timber frame walls, floors, or roofs to instruct CNC machines where to cut boarding or sheathing materials that are applied as specific zones."
  },
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "sApplyToolingToElementType",
      "technicalDefault": "Roof",
      "businessMeaning": "Filters the structural elements to be processed. Determines if the tooling applies to walls, floors, roofs, or combinations thereof.",
      "validRange": "Roof, Floor, Wall, or combinations (e.g., 'Wall;Floor')",
      "unit": "String (Selection)",
      "affectsOutput": "Restricts the script to only run on elements matching the selected type(s)."
    },
    {
      "name": "sApplyToolingTo",
      "technicalDefault": "Zone 1",
      "businessMeaning": "Selects the specific material layer (Zone) within the element to be processed (e.g., OSB sheathing on the outside vs. interior finish).",
      "validRange": "Zone 1 to Zone 10",
      "unit": "Integer Index (1-10)",
      "affectsOutput": "Defines the geometry source (the sheets) and the target layer for the toolpaths."
    },
    {
      "name": "identifierProp",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "A unique label to manage script instances. Prevents multiple scripts with the same ID from running on the same element, effectively creating 'slots' for different machining operations.",
      "validRange": "Any alphanumeric string (defaults to Zone Index if empty)",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Controls conflict resolution. If two instances have the same ID, one will replace the other."
    },
    {
      "name": "sInExcludeFilters",
      "technicalDefault": "Exclude",
      "businessMeaning": "Switch to determine if the material/label filters act as a whitelist (Include) or blacklist (Exclude).",
      "validRange": "Include, Exclude",
      "unit": "String (Selection)",
      "affectsOutput": "Determines which specific sheets within the zone are actually machined."
    },
    {
      "name": "sFilterMaterial",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Filters sheets by their assigned material name (e.g., 'OSB', 'ParticleBoard').",
      "validRange": "Any valid material name in the project",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Sheets not matching the filter criteria (if filter is active) will be ignored."
    },
    {
      "name": "sFilterLabel",
      "technicalDefault": "",
      "businessMeaning": "Filters sheets by a custom label assigned to the sheet.",
      "validRange": "Any valid label string in the project",
      "unit": "String",
      "affectsOutput": "Allows selective machining of specific sheets based on user-defined labels."
    },
    {
      "name": "sOnlySawExternalCorners",
      "technicalDefault": "No",
      "businessMeaning": "Strategy optimization. If Yes, the script will only generate saw cuts for external corners (convex geometry), forcing internal corners (concave) to be milled.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Changes the operation type at corners. Sawing is faster but can't handle tight internal corners as well as milling."
    },
    {
      "name": "sOnlyProcessOpenings",
      "technicalDefault": "No",
      "businessMeaning": "Limits the toolpath generation to only the interior holes/openings of the sheets, ignoring the outer perimeter.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "Suppresses tooling for the main sheet outline; only creates cutouts for windows/doors/penetrations."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMoveDirectionSaw",
      "technicalDefault": "None",
      "businessMeaning": "Restricts saw operations to specific segment orientations relative to the element's coordinate system (e.g., only allow sawing on longitudinal or transverse beams).",
      "validRange": "None, Horizontal, Vertical, Angled, or combinations",
      "unit": "String (Selection)",
      "affectsOutput": "Segments not matching the allowed direction are skipped for sawing and potentially handled by the mill settings."
    },
    {
      "name": "sMoveDirectionMill",
      "technicalDefault": "None",
      "businessMeaning": "Restricts milling operations to specific segment orientations.",
      "validRange": "None, Horizontal, Vertical, Angled, or combinations",
      "unit": "String (Selection)",
      "affectsOutput": "Segments not matching the allowed direction are skipped for milling."
    },
    {
      "name": "dMergeSheetingTolerance",
      "technicalDefault": "2 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "The maximum gap allowed between adjacent sheets to treat them as a single continuous sheet for toolpath calculation.",
      "validRange": "0 mm to 10 mm",
      "unit": "Length (mm)",
      "affectsOutput": "Larger values merge small gaps, reducing start/stop cycles. Smaller values treat every sheet edge individually."
    },
    {
      "name": "nToolingIndexSaw",
      "technicalDefault": "1",
      "businessMeaning": "The specific tool number (saw blade) assigned in the CNC machine's tool magazine for this operation.",
      "validRange": "1 to 99",
      "unit": "Integer (Count)",
      "affectsOutput": "Writes the specific tool number to the CNC output file for the saw operation."
    },
    {
      "name": "sSideSaw",
      "technicalDefault": "Left",
      "businessMeaning": "Determines which side of the line the saw cuts relative to the travel direction (Left or Right).",
      "validRange": "Left, Right",
      "unit": "Direction",
      "affectsOutput": "Affects kerf compensation and the exact position of the cut."
    },
    {
      "name": "sTurnSaw",
      "technicalDefault": "Against course",
      "businessMeaning": "The direction the saw head rotates or turns at corners.",
      "validRange": "Against course, With course",
      "unit": "Direction",
      "affectsOutput": "Influences machine motion dynamics."
    },
    {
      "name": "sOShootSawInternalCorners",
      "technicalDefault": "No",
      "businessMeaning": "Extends the saw cut slightly past the corner intersection to ensure a clean cut (overcut).",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "If Yes, the saw path extends beyond the geometry intersection point."
    },
    {
      "name": "sOShootSawExternalCorners",
      "technicalDefault": "Yes",
      "businessMeaning": "Extends the saw cut slightly past the external corner intersection.",
      "validRange": "Yes, No",
      "unit": "Boolean",
      "affectsOutput": "If Yes, the saw path extends beyond the geometry intersection point."
    },
    {
      "name": "dAdditionalDepthSaw",
      "technicalDefault": "1 mm",
      "businessMeaning": "An extra depth added to the cut to ensure the material is fully severed, compensating for unevenness or tool deflection.",
      "validRange": "0 mm to 10 mm",
      "unit": "Length (mm)",
      "affectsOutput": "Z-axis depth of the saw cut."
    },
    {
      "name": "addZoneThicknessToAdditionalDepthSaw",
      "technicalDefault": "-----",

workflowDiagram: 1. Script launched via command or catalog.
2. Check if `_kExecuteKey` is present and valid in catalog.
3. [Condition] If valid key, load properties from catalog; else, display Dialog for user input.
4. User confirms settings and initiates insertion.
5. Script prompts for Element selection (`PrEntity`).
6. Loop through selected elements: Check for existing script instances with the same 'Identifier'.
7. [Condition] If duplicate found, erase the old instance.
8. Create new TSL instance attached to the Element with current properties.
9. Erase the temporary 'insertion' script instance.
10. Each new instance executes on its host Element (Recalc).
11. Validate Element Type against 'Apply tooling to element type'.
12. Identify target Zone index.
13. Retrieve Sheets from the Zone.
14. Loop through Sheets: Apply Material/Label filters.
15. Extract and process Sheet geometry (Polylines).
16. Analyze geometry: Detect corner types (Internal/External) and segment directions (Horizontal/Vertical/Angled).
17. Determine Tooling Strategy: Check 'Allowed move direction' and 'Only saw external corners' settings.
18. [Condition] If Saw is allowed, generate `ElemSaw`. Else if Mill is allowed, generate `ElemMill`.
19. Calculate depth (Zone Thickness + Extra Depth + Optional Zone Thickness).
20. Add Tooling to Element.
21. Draw Visualisation symbols (3D and Plan views).

path1.name: Use Catalog Defaults
steps: Load properties silently without showing dialog.

path2.name: Manual Configuration
steps: User manually selects Zone, Saw/Mill settings, and Filters.

path1.name: Replace Existing
steps: Scan element for existing TSLs with script name 'HSB_E-Saw and Milllines'.
If match found, `dbErase()` the old instance.

path2.name: New Instance
steps: No matching identifier found on element.

path1.name: Process Sheet
steps: Compare Sheet Material and Label against properties.

path2.name: Skip Sheet
steps: Continue to next sheet in loop.

path1.name: Apply Saw
steps: Check 'Only saw external corners' (False or Corner is External).

path3.name: No Tooling
steps: Both Saw and Mill conditions failed (e.g., direction restricted).

path1.name: External Corner
steps: Use 'Overshoot saw external corners' and 'Overshoot mill external corners' settings.

path2.name: Internal Corner
steps: Use 'Overshoot saw internal corners' and 'Overshoot mill internal corners' settings.
Force Mill if 'Only saw external corners' is Yes.

validationRules.recovery: If `insertCycleCount() > 1`, script erases itself to prevent duplicate processing.
Defaults to Zone 1 if not set, but user must select a valid zone index (1-10) in properties to generate tooling.
Automatically handles conflicts by erasing the previous instance with the same identifier on the same element.

postInsertionActions.effect: Changing Zone, Tool Indexes, Overshoots, or Directions triggers a recalculation. Tooling on the element updates immediately.

postInsertionActions.how: Select Element -> Erase Script Instance (via TslInst dialog or selection filter)
postInsertionActions.effect: Removes all generated Saw and Mill tooling associated with this script's identifier from the element.
Displays a symbol (text and lines) in 3D and Plan views indicating the Identifier and processing status.

data.markdown:
# HSB_E-Saw and Milllines

## Overview
Automates the generation of CNC saw and milling toolpaths for sheeting zones (flooring, roofing, or cladding) on timber elements, optimizing cuts based on geometry and machine capabilities.

## Usage Environment
| Space | Supported | Notes |
|-------|-----------|-------|
| Model Space | Yes | Operates directly on Elements (Walls, Floors, Roofs). |
| Paper Space | No | Not applicable for layout views. |
| Shop Drawing | No | Generates production data, not drawing annotations. |

## Prerequisites
- **Required Entities**: An Element (Wall, Floor, or Roof) containing Zones/Sheets.
- **Minimum Beam Count**: 0 (This script processes sheeting geometry on elements).
- **Required Settings**: None required, but Catalog presets can speed up insertion.

## Usage Steps

### Step 1: Launch Script
Command: `TSLINSERT` â†’ Select `HSB_E-Saw and Milllines.mcr` OR click the Catalog icon if pre-configured.

### Step 2: Configure Settings (Dialog)
If not using a catalog preset, a dialog will appear.
```
Action: Select the target Zone (e.g., Zone 1 for exterior sheathing).
Action: Set Tooling Indexes for Saw and Mill operations.
Action: Configure filters (Material/Label) if only specific sheets need machining.
Action: Click OK to confirm.
```

### Step 3: Select Element
```
Command Line: Select Element:
Action: Click on the Wall, Floor, or Roof element to process.
```

### Step 4: Completion
The script attaches to the element. Visual symbols (text/lines) appear on the info layer to indicate the tooling has been calculated and added to the element.

## Properties Panel Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| **Apply tooling to element type** | String | Roof | Filters which elements are processed (e.g., Roof, Floor, Wall). |
| **Apply tooling to** | String | Zone 1 | Selects the specific Zone index (1-10) to machine. |
| **Identifier** | String | *Zone Index* | Unique ID to allow multiple instances of this script on the same element (e.g., one for Zone 1, one for Zone 2). |
| **In/Exclude Filters** | Dropdown | Exclude | Sets if the Material/Label filters act as a whitelist (Include) or blacklist (Exclude). |
| **Filter Material** | String | *Empty* | Filters sheets by Material name (e.g., "OSB"). Leave empty to ignore. |
| **Filter Label** | String | *Empty* | Filters sheets by Label name. Leave empty to ignore. |
| **Only saw external corners** | Yes/No | No | If Yes, internal corners are forced to be milled instead of sawed. |
| **Only process openings** | Yes/No | No | If Yes, only cuts out openings (windows/doors) and ignores the outer perimeter. |
| **Merge sheeting tolerance** | Double | 2 mm | Maximum gap between sheets to treat them as one continuous sheet. |
| **Tooling index saw** | Integer | 1 | CNC tool number for the saw operation. |
| **Side saw** | Dropdown | Left | Side of the cut line the saw cuts on (Left/Right). |
| **Turn saw** | Dropdown | Against course | Saw head direction at corners. |
| **Overshoot saw internal corners** | Yes/No | No | Extends the cut past the intersection for internal corners. |
| **Overshoot saw external corners** | Yes/No | Yes | Extends the cut past the intersection for external corners. |
| **Additional depth saw** | Double | 1 mm | Extra cut depth to ensure material is fully severed. |
| **Add zone thickness to additional depth** | String | ----- | Adds the thickness of a specific zone to the saw depth. |
| **Move direction saw** | Dropdown | None | Restricts sawing to specific segment directions (Horizontal/Vertical/Angled). |
| **Tooling index mill** | Integer | 1 | CNC tool number for the milling operation. |
| **Side mill** | Dropdown | Left | Side of the path the mill cuts on. |
| **Overshoot mill internal corners** | Yes/No | No | Extends the mill path past internal corners. |
| **Overshoot mill external corners** | Yes/No | Yes | Extends the mill path past external corners. |
| **Additional depth mill** | Double | 0 mm | Extra depth for milling operations. |
| **Move direction mill** | Dropdown | None | Restricts milling to specific segment directions. |

## Right-Click Menu Options
*Note: Specific custom menu items were not identified in the analysis. Standard script options (Recalculate, Erase) apply.*

## Settings Files
None required. The script relies on Element properties and Zone definitions.

## Tips
- **Multiple Instances**: Use the **Identifier** property to run different machining strategies on the same element. For example, set Identifier to "ExtSaw" for exterior sheathing and "IntMill" for interior sheeting.
- **Optimizing Machine Time**: Increase the **Merge sheeting tolerance** (e.g., to 5 mm) to combine small gaps between sheets. This creates continuous paths and reduces machine start/stop cycles.
- **Corner Quality**: Enable **Only saw external corners** if your machine struggles with tight internal corners using a saw. This forces the script to use the mill for precise internal cuts while keeping the fast saw for external edges.
- **Filtering**: If you only want to cut openings for windows in a wall that is otherwise sheeted on site, set **Only process openings** to "Yes".

## FAQ
- **Q: Why didn't the script generate any toolpaths?**
  - **A:** Check the **Apply tooling to element type** property. If your element is a "Wall" but the script is set to "Roof", it will skip processing. Also, ensure the selected Zone actually contains sheets.
- **Q: Can I mix sawing and milling on the same sheet?**
  - **A:** Yes. Use the **Only saw external corners** option, or set **Move direction** filters differently for Saw vs Mill. For instance, you might allow sawing only on "Horizontal" cuts and force all "Vertical" cuts to be milled.
- **Q: What happens if I change the Zone index in the properties?**
  - **A:** The script automatically recalculates and updates the tooling on the element to match the new Zone geometry.
